<h3 id="X3146">X(3146)&nbsp;=&nbsp;X(253)-CEVA CONJUGATE OF X(2)</h3>
Trilinears&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; u(-u/x +
v/y + w/z) : v(u/x - v/y + w/z) : w(u/x + v/y - w/z), where x : y : z =
X(253) and u : v : w = X(2)
<br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
4 cos A - 3 sin B sin C : 4 cos B - 3 sin C sin A : 4 cos C - 3 sin A sin B
<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp; af(a,b,c) : bf(b,c,a) : cf(c,a,b), where
f(a,b,c) = u(-u/x + v/y + w/z)
<br>
Barycentrics&nbsp;&nbsp; g(a,b,c) : g(b,c,a) : g(c,a,b), where g(a,b,c)
= 5a<sup>4</sup> - 2a<sup>2</sup>(b<sup>2</sup> + c<sup>2</sup>) -
3(b<sup>2</sup> - c<sup>2</sup>)<sup>2</sup> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
(E. Danneels)
<p>
As a point on the Euler line, X(3146) has Shinagawa coefficients (1, -4).
</p>
<p>
The point X(3146) exemplifies a theorem based on a discussion in Tran Quang Hung and Peter Moses, <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=25668">Hyacinthos 25668</a>.
The theorem (Peter Moses, April 10, 2017) is as follows.
</p>
<p>
Suppose that P is a point on a circumhyperbola H.  Let A'B'C' be the cevian triangle of P and let O' be the circumcircle of A'B'C'.  Let A'' be the point other than A' that lies on both O' and line BC, and define B'' and C'' cyclically.  The orthocenter of A"B"C" lies on the isogonal conjugate of H.
</p>
<p>
Writing P' for the orthocenter of of A"B"C", examples of the mapping P &srarr; P' include the following:<br>
Jerabek hyperbola &srarr; Euler line<br>
Feuerbach hyperbola &srarr; X(1)X(3)<br>
Kiepert hyperbola &srarr; Brocard axis.
</p>
<p>
The image of a point P = a^2 / (S^2+k SB SC) : : on the Jerabek hyperbola is the following point on the Euler line:
</p>
<p>
(S^2 SA SB+S^2 SB^2+S^2 SA SC+4 S^2 SB SC+3 k SA SB^2 SC+S^2 SC^2+3 k SA SB SC^2+2 k SB^2 SC^2) (S^4 SA^3+S^4 SA^2 SB+S^4 SA SB^2-2 k S^2 SA^3 SB^2-k^2 SA^4 SB^3+S^4 SA^2 SC+7 S^4 SA SB SC-2 k S^2 SA^3 SB SC+2 S^4 SB^2 SC+8 k S^2 SA^2 SB^2 SC-3 k^2 SA^4 SB^2 SC+2 k S^2 SA SB^3 SC+k^2 SA^3 SB^3 SC+S^4 SA SC^2-2 k S^2 SA^3 SC^2+2 S^4 SB SC^2+8 k S^2 SA^2 SB SC^2-3 k^2 SA^4 SB SC^2+14 k S^2 SA SB^2 SC^2+3 k^2 SA^3 SB^2 SC^2+2 k S^2 SB^3 SC^2+7 k^2 SA^2 SB^3 SC^2-k^2 SA^4 SC^3+2 k S^2 SA SB SC^3+k^2 SA^3 SB SC^3+2 k S^2 SB^2 SC^3+7 k^2 SA^2 SB^2 SC^3+5 k^2 SA SB^3 SC^3)
</p>
<p>
For P = X(69), the parameter k = = -SW S^2 / (SA SB SC), and P' = X(3146)<br>
For P = X(68), see X(13322).
</p>
<p>
X(3146) lies on the cubics K117, K127, K347, K425, K461, K558, K841, and these lines:
{1,5556}, {2,3}, {7,950}, {8,144}, {10,9778}, {11,5265}, {12,5281}, {13,5366}, {14,5365}, {33,4296}, {34,3100}, {35,10590}, {36,10591}, {40,3219}, {51,10574}, {52,6241}, {55,5229}, {56,5225}, {9799,9965}, {10404,11038}, {10446,10454}, {10453,12545}, {10625,11459}, {10711,10993}, {10738,12248}, {10749,12253}, {11004,11456}, {11411,12293}, {11412,11455}, {11416,11470}, {11417,11473}, {11418,11474}, {11420,11475}, {11421,11476}, {11432,11820}, {11523,12536}, {11750,12897}, {12160,12315}, {12219,12292}, {12220,12294}, {12223,12298}, {12224,12299}, {12226,12300}, {12282,12290}, {12317,12902}, {12684,12690}
</p>
<p>
X(3146) = midpoint of X(i) in X(j) for these {i,j}: {382,5073}, {3529,11541}<br>
X(3146) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these (i,j): (2,3543), (3,3627), (4,382), (8,5691), (20,4), (74,12295), (145,962), (146,10721), (147,10722), (148,10723), (149,10724), (150,10725), (151,10726), (152,10727), (153,10728), (376,3830), (550,3853), (944,12699), (1657,5), (3448,10733), (3529,3), (3869,12688), (5059,20), (5189,10296), (5925,6247), (5984,148), (6225,5895), (6240,7553), (6241,52), (6361,355), (9862,6321), (9961,65), (10430,3586), (10575,5446), (11001,381), (11411,12293), (11412,12162), (11750,12897), (12103,12102), (12111,11381), (12121,1539), (12219,12292), (12220,12294), (12221,12296), (12222,12297), (12223,12298), (12224,12299), (12225,1885), (12226,12300), (12244,265), (12246,5787), (12248,10738), (12253,10749), (12279,185), (12317,12902), (12383,7728), (12536,11523)<br>
X(3146) = isogonal conjugate of X(3532)<br>
X(3146) = isotomic conjugate of X(35510)<br>
X(3146) = isotomic conjugate of polar conjugate of X(33630)<br>
X(3146) = complement of X(5059)<br>
X(3146) = anticomplement of X(20)<br>
X(3146) = X(253)-Ceva conjugate of X(2)<br>
X(3146) = crosspoint of X(1131) and X(1132)<br>
X(3146) = crosspoint of PU(i) for these i: 116, 117<br>
X(3146) = crosssum of X(1151) and X(1152)<br>
X(3146) = orthocentroidal-circle-inverse of X(3832)<br>
X(3146) = intersection of tangents to Kiepert hyperbola at X(1131) and X(1132)<br>
X(3146) = orthocenter of cevian triangle of X(253)<br>
X(3146) = X(11531)-of-orthic-triangle if ABC is acute<br>
X(3146) = polar conjugate of X(38253)<br>
X(3146) = pole wrt polar circle of trilinear polar of X(38253) (line X(523)X(13473))<br>
X(3146) = circumcircle-inverse of X(37941)<br>
X(3146) = X(19)-isoconjugate of X(36609)<br>
X(3146) = exsimilicenter of polar circle and de Longchamps circle<br>
X(3146) = Ehrmann-mid-to-Johnson similarity image of X(382)<br>
X(3146) =  {X(i),X(j)}-harmonic conjugate of X(k) for these (i,j,k): (2,4,3832), (2,20,3522), (2,3832,5068), (2,3854,5), (2,5059,20), (2,6872,11106), (3,4,3091), (3,5,3525), (3,381,3628),
